text:
Are you sure
I can do this?

We've rehearsed
and you're a natural, Marinette.

But every time I'm alone with
him, I get so flustered and--

You won't be alone.
I'll stay right here.
What if he doesn't laugh?

He will.
You told me he knew my sketches.

Of course, don't forget
to always add
the gimmick at the end.

That's what gives rhythm to the
sketch and lets the audience--

I mean, Adrien,
know that it's time to laugh.
Yeehaw?
Yeehaw.

- Marinette?
- Oh! Adrien!
You like Harry Clown, too?
Uh, I've been invited, but I--

You think he'll do his sketch
on the clumsy sheriff?
Uh, the clumsy, who?
Oh! Oh, where did my hat go?
Uh, right there.
Yeehaw!
Oh, right. There it is!
Ah, silly old me!

- Sorry.
- Sorry.
Ah, there it is!
Yeehaw!
( phone ringing )

- Bob, hi.
- You're supposed to be here!

Of course, I haven't forgotten.
Just give me five minutes.

- We have rehearsal!
- Yes, I understand, but--

- Get here now.
- Not even two minutes?

- No, get here now!
- Fine. I'll be right there.

Check out my sheriff star.
Shiny, right? Yeehaw?

You're acting kind of strange.
Are you okay?
What? No, no. I'm fine.

Look at the sheriff--
I mean, the star.
What'd you do that for?
I'm sorry.
Hang on.
